text: Oh
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make apple turnovers
perfect for this time of year because
apples are in season so I figured I'm
going to share this recipe with you it's
easy to make and then we take here with
ingredients so we can get started I'm
going to some chopped apples I'm using a
combination of granny smith apples and
Honey Crisp brown sugar salt cinnamon
all-purpose flour orange unsalted butter
you're gonna need some raw sugar an egg
wash which is just 1 egg beaten with a
little bit of water or milk and some
puff pastry which I have keeping cold in
the fridge because you know how puff
pastry is once it gets warm it's a
little finicky to work with so the first
thing you do is get your oven preheated
to about 400 the second thing you want
to do is take two baking sheets lined
with parchment paper and now let's get
going we're going to actually cook to
make sure the apple mixture a little bit
so that it the apples are cooked because
if I want to just put the raw mixture
into puff pastry and straight into the
oven then the apple will still have you
know a bit too much texture for my
liking so I cook the mixture beforehand
in the feel it I have got my um butter
that I have here melting over about
medium heat I'm going to add in my
apples I'm just using combination of
Granny Smith and honey crisps because
the granny smith apples are really nice
and torch and the Honey Crisp or

little bit less sugar and still get a
really good texture from the Granny
Smith
now I've peeled them quarter them and
cut them into bite-size pieces so that
sounds good and I'm going to get this
cooking this is probably going to cook
for about five to seven minutes I'm
actually going to add some orange zest
to this first about the zest of half of
an orange I love love the combination of
orange or just about anything really and
I think here it really plays off it's
almost like resembled apple pie feelings
because I do put some orange in my apple
pie filling so I like that and I'm going
to add some brown sugar as well and I'm
going to let this whole thing cook for
about five to seven minutes or until the
apples have softened just a bit
my apples have been cooking for about
seven minutes and they're beginning to
soften which is just how I want it now
I'm going to add in my flour cinnamon
and salt and the flour is really a
crucial ingredient here because the
flours are the thicken up those juices
because otherwise it's going to make the
see the actual puff pastry really soggy
which I don't want that so the flour is
going to help thicken it thicken those
juices and just be absolutely delicious
I'm just going to cook this for two
minutes while constantly stirring or
until I see that the juices are begins
to thicken nicely and then I'm going to
let this cool for a bit before getting
out the puff pastry and getting these
stuffed and ready my Apple mixture has
cold and I've got my sheet of puff

out an inch bigger or each on all sides
really just to get it a little bit
bigger than it is alright that looks
good enough and now I'm going to just
cut this into four squares as even as
you possibly can and then just take a
small scoop of Apple mixture you don't
want to put too much because then they
can kind of explode and that defeats the
purpose of having a turnover because
it'll be all over the place so just fill
each one okay my last four and this
apple filling smells so good I wish I
smell what I'm smelling
mm-hmm-hmm now just brush the edges with
some egg wash so that when you close
them they stick together
seal like the glue for pastries what I
like to call it and now just fold them
together and then just pinch everything
to seal and put them on your prepared
baking sheet last one and then I'm going
to take a fork dip it in flour and just
go all around the edges just to make
sure that they're all really nicely
sealed and you can make the these in a
smaller version if you wanted to I make
big ones because Who am I kidding I'm
going to eat things our thing so I want
to eat a nice sized turnover
and then I'm going to take a knife and
make a slip right on top of each one
that allows the steam to escape and it
doesn't puff up so much and then brush
the top with your egg wash and just
sprinkle the top with some raw sugar
just put a little extra sweetness and
crunch and these are going to go into
